thread.title: Deejay Dallas powers Glynn Academy past Bradwell
thread.title_full: Deejay Dallas powers Glynn Academy past Bradwell

author: Mike Morrison
title: Deejay Dallas powers Glynn Academy past Bradwell
text:
Deejay Dallas powers Glynn Academy past Bradwell 
By Mike Morrison Sat, Oct 3, 2015 @ 3:27 am 
BRUNSWICK —Deejay Dallas rushed for 186 yards in his second start at quarterback to lead the Glynn Academy Red Terrors to a 24-0 win over the visiting Bradwell Institute Tigers Friday. 
Dallas, a junior who has committed to the University of Georgia, scored all three of the Terrors touchdowns as they improved to 4-2 overall, 3-1 in Region 3- . 
Dallas had lined up at wide receiver and defensive back prior to taking over at quarterback following Glynn’s 22-0 loss to Coffee County two weeks ago. 
Coach Rocky Hidalgo said having the speedy Dallas at quarterback opens up running lanes for his other backs. 
“The defense has to keep their eyes on him,” he said. 
Junior running back Jeremiah Anderson gained 88 yards and senior Morris Demery 63 as the Terrors racked up 363 rushing yards. 
Winless Bradwell gained 117 yards on the ground, with Luther Echols leading the way with 56 yards on 12 carries. 
Dallas scored on runs of 14 and 1 yards in the first quarter as the Terrors threatened to turn the game into a blowout. But Bradwell’s defense stiffened in the second quarter. 
“They played hard,” Hidalgo said. “They were in a tough situation, but they didn’t quit.” 
Banks Entwistle kicked a 33-yard field goal in the third quarter to put Glynn ahead 17-0, and Dallas later scored on a 7-yard run to cap a 75-yard drive. 
Dallas rushed for 108 yards and three touchdowns and passed for 112 yards and a touchdown in his first start at quarterback last week, a 49-7 win over Richmond Hill. 
He’ll get a more stern test next Friday, when Glynn travels to Waycross to take on the undefeated Ware County Gators. 
Glynn Academy 24, Bradwell Institute 0 
BI — 0 0 0 0 — 0 
GA — 14 0 3 7 — 24 
GA — Deejay Dallas 14 run (Scout Churchwell kick) 
GA — Dallas 1 run (Banks Entwistle kick) 
GA — Entwistle 33 field goal 
GA — Dallas 7 run (Churchwell kick)
